page.title: 11Working on the railway Cont
page.content:
At{New Romney,}in the sidings we help clean the engines. We use paraffin for the wheels and the piston rods and Brasso for the name plates and around the windows. We wash down the carriages, wipe down the seats and wash the windows of the signal boxes at New Romney and Hythe.
Before we could help with the work on the railway we had to join the {Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch Railway {Association.}It costs Â£3.60 a year for a child and about Â£7.00 for an adult and means we can have rides at halfprice and reduced prices in the shops at New Romney and Hythe.
